Charlie Curnow is the ultimate tease - one of the competition's most electric players when fit and firing, but too often not on the park to showcase his talents.
With Carlton revealing Curnow will likely have to sit out the 2020 season -- assuming it does ev… [+3770 chars]

articles.author: Racenet
articles.title: Chad Schofield continues hot run in Hong Kong as Moreira rides treble - Racenet
articles.description: “I do feel like I’m probably riding as well as I ever have,” Schofield said. “It’s just flowing along nicely but it’s a combination of getting some better quality rides and obviously my confidence is high on the back of the winners.
articles.content:
Australian jockey Chad Schofield has continued his rich vein of form and remains on track for a career year in Hong Kong after riding a treble on Sunday.
Schofield is now just four wins shy of a career best of 38 wins in a season following another strong day… [+1892 chars]

articles.title: Vegadaze euthanised after post surgery fall - Racenet
articles.description: Vegadaze, the classy sprinter who nearly toppled star colt The Autumn Sun in his prime, has tragically died following an incident over the weekend.
articles.content:

articles.title: Does Dusty have Chris Judd covered to this point in their careers? - SEN
articles.description: Some AFL greats debated the topic.
articles.content:
Who would you take Dustin Martin right now or Chris Judd at the equivalent point of his career, 225 games in?
Judd has the extra Brownlow, while Martin has the second premiership and second Norm Smith Medal.
Martin has kicked more goals, but has three less … [+1174 chars]

articles.title: Jumps jockey gets a minth for improper riding - Racenet
articles.description: A jumps jockey was banned for a month for improper riding at Sunday’s Pakenham meeting.
articles.content:
A jumps jockey was banned for a month for improper riding at Sunday’s Pakenham meeting.
Jockey Will Gordon received the penalty when he was found guilty of improper riding on Coleridge in the Ecycle Solutions Maiden Hurdle (3200m).

articles.title: Around 10 per cent of Queensland students back at school today - 9News
articles.description: Roughly 100,000 students are expected to attend schools across Queensland from Monday amid closures due to the coronavirus pandemic.
